medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms related to balance began around 2001 with subtle disequilibrium during yoga. Neurological examination revealed left-sided subtle ataxia and further evaluation showed multiple tiny infarcts. There was a decline in bone mineral density as indicated by BMD tests from T scores of -0.6 in the hip in 2000 to -2.3 in 2005 for the spine.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of one distant episode of nephrolithiasis, episodic benign positional vertigo, mild recurrent sciatica secondary to a ruptured L3-L4 disk.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had a wrist fracture around the age of 60 and began taking alendronate after a bone density test in her mid-80s.
medical_history.social_history: The patient maintains an active lifestyle, plays golf regularly, takes calcium and multivitamins, consumes one glass of beer or wine nightly, does not smoke or use recreational drugs, and works in business with commercial medical insurance.
